newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Bank Negara 91-day bill average yield at 6.687 pct.
newsitem.headline: Bank Negara 91-day bill average yield at 6.687 pct.

text.p: Malaysia's central bank said it accepted bids at an average yield of 6.687 percent at its auction of 91-day Bank Negara bills for 500 million ringgit.
At its previous auction on October 14 for a similar amount, bids were accepted at an average yield of 6.649 percent.
The accepted bids were in the high/low range of 6.70/645 percent against 6.657/635 last week.

The central bank also auctioned 30-day Bank Negara bills to raise 500 million ringgit. The bids accepted were at an average yield of 6.689 percent against 6.633 accepted at an auction for a similar amount last week.
The bids accepted for the 30-day bills were in the high/low range of 6.720/555 percent against 6.660/555 last week.
Payment for both issues is on Wednesday.
While 500 million ringgit will come from a maturing Bank Negara bill, a large part of the remaining amount is expected to come from a Bank Negara deposit which matured on Tuesday, dealers said.
